climbs.name: Sponge Bob Square Pants
climbs.fa: Kelly Cordner, John Barbella, Cameron Winston

content.description: Start up Tai's 10c for 3 bolts, traverse left across patio and up corner by bolts 4,5,6 to vertical headwall. Juggy, flake holds from then on. At bolt 9 traverse right. Bolts 10/11 are hidden on the rhs of nearby flake. Crux is between 11 and anchors.

Climb the first three bolts of Sponge Bob square pants, then continue up via the two parallel, tightly bolted cracks using a combination of liebacks, stemming, and bearhugs.  It is also possible to climb the right crack only, more head on.  This felt slightly harder.  Fun route with good movement.
content.location: Same start as for Sponge Bob Square Pants.

content.description: Move up the flaring crack to dual cracks (left fist/OW, right hands) to a short OW section and a few face moves to the anchor.
content.location: The route immediately to the right of the start of Sponge Bob Square Pants.

content.description: Climb up on edges and jugs to a short crack, then pass a shallow, right facing dihedral to lower angle ground.  A bit R from the 6th bolt to the anchor, but it's really easy climbing.  Overall, this is a really fun route on clean rock and a good warm up for the other routes on the mini buttress.  Note that communication can be difficult due to noise from the creek and no direct sight line to the anchor.
content.location: See pic.  Six bolt route around the corner to the left of Sponge Bob Square Pants.
